I have created a custom JUnit4=
 Runner:

@RunWith(junit.extensions.pb4.ParameterizedBeforeRunner.class)

S=
upports an optional parameter to be passed into static @BeforeClass
methods=
:

  @BeforeClass
  public static void setUpBefore(Properties p) ...

The r=
ules are:

If your test class is in a package com.foo.bar, then in your
cla=
sspath the directory com/foo/bar one can place a standard Java
 .properties=
 file. If your test class is called 'ASimpleTestSuite'
then the file MUST b=
e called 'asimpletestsuite.properties'
(all-lower).

The same Properties is=
 passed to any @AfterClass with the
appropriate method signature. Regular J=
Unit4 @BeforeClass/@AfterClass
methods without the Properties argument stil=
l work.

Additionally there is a System Property that is a global
merge/ove=
rride:

-Djunit.extensions.parameterizedB4.properties=3D{path_to}/override.=
properties

any keys in override.properties will (obviously) override those=
 same
keys from the testclass' local 'XXX.properties'; otherwise, the
opera=
tion is a merge of the 2 sets of Properties.

I have made this runner work =
with the suite runner:

@RunWith(ParameterizedBeforeRunner.class)
@SuiteCla=
sses({
    ASimpleTestSuite.class,
    AnotherSimpleTestSuite.class
})

itional changes:
 - added a state machine to standard test listeners so tha=
